definition: to evade/to shirk
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: And then to its position choice, some do, some shirk.
sentences.chinese: 然后再以自己的立场抉择，有些做，有些推脱。

sentences.english: Start something you've been putting off.
sentences.chinese: 开始着手做你一直推脱的事。

sentences.english: Write down anything that cannot be pushed off to the following day.
sentences.chinese: 写下那些不能推脱到第二天去做的事情。

sentences.english: You run around in a tizzy trying to do all those last minute things you procrastinated about the night before.
sentences.chinese: 你急急忙忙去做那些你前一晚上推脱没做的琐事。

sentences.english: Shirk, however, had quietly replaced the king Laoqin be holy raincoat.
sentences.chinese: 推脱不过，老秦只好默默地换上了王可圣的雨衣。

sentences.english: Keys. Oh…it is a reason that I can shirks .
sentences.chinese: 这就是我不能推脱的原因。
吉姆将罪责推脱得一干二净。

sentences.english: This is an excuse that we all use.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们常用的推脱之词。

sentences.english: HanYing subsidizes master Dao Yin RenHui with the war had exhausted by evade James spirit.
sentences.chinese: 道贤用跟仁惠的战争曾经耗尽了精神为由推脱詹姆斯。

definition: to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
to decline (an appointment, invitation etc)
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to repel/to decline
to use all sorts of excuses
to make an excuse/pretext/excuse
to look for a pretext
to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext
to plead/to claim as an excuse
to find an excuse
see 託詞|托词[tuo1 ci2]
see 託詞|托词[tuo1 ci2]
to rebuff/to refuse/to turn down
to agree (to do sth)/to promise
to tactfully decline/to turn down gracefully
to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
